result.execSummary:
The defendant Katelynn C Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katelynn C Clark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katelynn C Clark was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Katelynn C Clark was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  205 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter has resolved. DE enters a plea of guilty as to Cts 2, 3 - found guilty by the court. Ct1 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year on each count w/conditions concurrent with each other. 19 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  DE may seek expunction upon successful completion of probation. Appeal rights given.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  234 - Possible resolution being negotiated. ST requests adjournment to further examine resolution - granted. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  240 - Atty Hertz-McGrath has offered a possible settlement which is under consideration. Bond continues and FPT  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
